instructions.instruction: As a bakery consultant visiting a struggling bakery, identify improvements needed to enhance the customer experience during morning hours.
As a theme park designer, plan a new walking path that maximizes guest enjoyment for all age groups.
As a museum curator, review an exhibit space and recommend changes to increase visitor engagement.
As a restaurant manager, assess the dining area during dinner service and propose ways to increase guest satisfaction.
As a safety officer on a factory floor, conduct a walkthrough and identify potential risks affecting staff performance.
As an event planner at a conference venue, walk through the main hall and outline suggestions to boost attendee energy and focus.
As a hotel quality inspector, visit a guest room and report on any elements that could enhance or diminish a guest's stay.
As a children's museum exhibit designer, evaluate a prototype play area for opportunities to improve learning and engagement.
As a barista trainer, visit a coffee shop during peak hours and provide feedback on the drink preparation area and customer waiting space.
As a retail consultant in a flagship clothing store, identify factors that could drive higher customer interest and dwell time.
As a spa manager, experience a standard treatment as a guest and suggest enhancements to the overall service.
As a cruise ship activities coordinator, tour a new entertainment deck and develop ideas to increase passenger participation.
As a product designer, interact with a new prototype household appliance and record areas for possible improvement.
As a real estate agent preparing an open house, check the property and propose ways to make it more appealing to buyers.
As a theme restaurant owner, dine as a customer during a typical lunch and list suggestions for a more memorable visit.
As a playground safety inspector, review a recently installed play structure and note any concerns or adjustments needed.
As a vineyard tour guide, walk through the visitor route and propose ways to elevate the tour experience.
As a mobile phone usability tester, use the latest model for a day and describe any issues or enhancements to consider.
As a hotel housekeeping supervisor, inspect a serviced suite just before guest arrival and provide a readiness assessment.
As a theme park food stall manager, work a lunch shift and outline recommendations to improve throughput and guest contentment.
As a boutique perfumery owner, experience the customer journey from entrance to purchase and suggest improvements.
As a gourmet chocolatier, sample your shop’s offerings and recommend potential changes to the product lineup.
As a classroom environment consultant, visit a primary school classroom during a lesson and identify modifications to support student focus.
As a supermarket floor manager, tour the produce section and detail how the setup could be optimized for shoppers.
As a fitness center owner, attend a busy group class and highlight steps to make the environment more motivating for participants.
